Authors: Ronald A., Yesmaya V., Danaparamita M.
Title: Personal security tracking based on android and web application
Affiliations: Computer Science Department, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Ronald, A., Computer Science Department, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Yesmaya, V., Computer Science Department, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Danaparamita, M., Computer Science Department, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Nowadays, the frequency of abduction is increasing significantly. Information technology provide many social media which is causing the leaked of personal information where abductor can find out the information. Using social media, people can share location, life event, and anything related about their life event, these become the useful information for the abductor. To anticipate this, a lot of personal tracking device is developed, but the response is too late. Because, the family or relative of the victims will notice that abduction had happen after the victim is lost. According to the problem, this research will focus on develop the personal tracking device which trigger by the victims who own the phone based on android and web application. Whenever the abduction happens, the victim just need to click the button and the system will send a message to the relatives and family in their contact also trigger the notification to the local security. Software development life cycle that will be used is scrum which is divided into several processes like backlog, sprints, scrum meetings, and demos. The result of this research is android application for user and web application for managing application. © 2018 Universitas Ahmad Dahlan.
Author Keywords: Android application; Decision support system; Tracking application; Web application
References: Kinage, R., Kumari, J., Zalke, P., Kulkarni, M., Mobile Tracking Application (2013) International Journal of Innovative Research in Science, Engineering and Technology, 2 (3), pp. 617-623; Shirin, S., Dipina, D.B., Surekha, M.V., Mobile Tracker (2016) International Journal on Cybernetics and Informatics, 5 (2), pp. 213-219; Abhijeet, T., Ahemad, T., Ravindra, S., Pranay, D., Sumit, H., Mobile Tracking Application for Locating Friends using LBS (2013) International Journal of Innovative Research in Computer and Communication Engineering, 1 (2), pp. 303-308; Abha, D., Hardik, S., Krishna, S., Global Positioning System for Object Tracking (2015) International of Computer Application, 109 (8), pp. 40-45; Pressman, R.S., Maxim, B.R., (2010) Software Engineering: A Practitioner's Approach, , Eighth Edition. Title: Understanding the influence of poor scope management affecting the successful of an IT Project
Source title: Proceedings of 2016 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2016
Affiliations: School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Adam, A.R., School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Danaparamita, M., School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Abstract: Information technology project failure is the problem which quite hard to avoid. The main problems of IT project failure are scope, time, and cost. These three contains is affecting to each other. Time and cost are the impact of the changing in scope. About 50% - 80% of IT Projects are defined as failure project which is mostly caused by over time and over cost. In client side, the problems come from unrealistic expectations also misunderstanding in collecting requirements in order to develop a system. These problems are leading into many changes in system development and changes will leads into poor scope management. In this research, we will analyze the influence of poor scope management affecting the successful of IT Project. In this research, began by analyze the correlation between Unrealistic Expectation and Changes in Project. The second steps is to analyze the correlation between Changes in Project and Overtime and Overcost. The Third steps it to analyze the Failure Project which defined by acceptance status of client and its correlation with Overcost and Overtime. Statistic method used in this research is Chi-Square. The result shows a tight bond between Unrealistic Expectation to Project Failure. © 2016 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Change Management; IT Failure; IT Project Management; Scope Management; Unrealistic Expectation
Index Keywords: Information management; Project management; Change management; Information technology projects; It project managements; Project failures; Scope management; Statistic method; System development; Unrealistic Expectation; Costs

Authors: Adam A.R., Hidajat M., Danaparamita M., Stevanus B., Wijayakusuma A., Christian
Title: Plant encyclopedia with image matching on a web-based application: Evaluation and implementation of SURF algorithm
Source title: Proceedings of 2016 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2016
Affiliations: School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Adam, A.R., School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Hidajat, M., School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Danaparamita, M., School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Stevanus, B., School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Wijayakusuma, A., School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Christian, School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Abstract: The Plantcyclopedia application is developed to provide plant information. The difference between this research application and others is the search feature based on an image. The search feature is designed to match the shape and orientation. This application uses a Speeded Up Robust Features (SURF) algorithm to conduct the matching feature process. The SURF algorithm is divided into three main steps. The first step is to retrieve the image information and turn it into a matrix, using a Hessian - Laplace Technique to define the feature point following the integral to reduce the computational time. It also uses a Difference of Gaussian in order to handle the object with an invariant scale. This process is called Fast Hessian. The second step is to define the orientation of the image using a Haar Wavelet Responses Technique. The third step is to match the feature points from both images using a four dimensional vector and K-Means as a classification technique. The result of this research is an application which is able to collect plant information using image matching. © 2016 IEEE.
Index Keywords: Information management; Web services; CBIR; Classification technique; Dimensional vectors; encyclopedia; Research applications; Speeded up robust features; SURF; Web-based applications; Image matching

Title: Comparing student model accuracy with bayesian network and fuzzy logic in predicting student knowledge level
Source title: International Journal of Multimedia and Ubiquitous Engineering
Affiliations: Bina Nusantara University, Jl. Kebon Jeruk Raya 27, Kebon Jeruk, Jakarta Barat 11530, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Danaparamita, M., Bina Nusantara University, Jl. Kebon Jeruk Raya 27, Kebon Jeruk, Jakarta Barat 11530, Indonesia; Lumban Gaol, F., Bina Nusantara University, Jl. Kebon Jeruk Raya 27, Kebon Jeruk, Jakarta Barat 11530, Indonesia
Abstract: The use of computer has widely used as a tool to help student in learning, one of the computer application to help student in learning is in the form of Intelligent Tutoring System. Intelligent Tutoring System used to diagnose student knowledge state and provide adaptive assistance to student. However, diagnosing student knowledge level is a difficult task due to rife with uncertainty. Student Model is the key component in Intelligent Tutoring System to deal with uncertainty. Bayesian Network and Fuzzy Logic is the most widely used to develop student model. In this paper we will compare the accuracy of student model developed with Bayesian Network and Fuzzy Logic in predicting student knowledge level. © 2014 SERSC.
Author Keywords: Bayesian network; Fuzzy logic; Intelligent tutoring system; Student model
Index Keywords: Bayesian networks; Computer aided instruction; Education computing; Fuzzy logic; Intelligent tutoring system; Student knowledge; Student Modeling; Students
